meals.name: Pepper Steak Stir Fry
method: Cook the rice and keep warm.
Slice the steak thinly and toss with soy sauce and a little cornstarch; rest 5 minutes.
Stir-fry sliced peppers in a hot pan with a little oil for 2–3 minutes; set aside.
Sear steak quickly on high heat; add garlic and ginger for 30 seconds.
Return peppers, add a splash of soy/water, and stir until glossy. Serve over rice.

meals.name: Garlic Beef and Broccoli Noodles
method: Cook noodles, drain, and set aside.
Steam or blanch broccoli until bright green; set aside.
Toss sliced steak with soy, hoisin, sugar, ginger, pepper, and a little cornstarch.
Stir-fry mushrooms and garlic, then add beef and cook quickly on high heat.
Add broccoli and noodles, finish with sesame oil and chili flakes, and toss to coat.

meals.name: Thai Green Curry
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Brown chicken pieces in a pot with a little oil.
Stir in green curry paste for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk, fish sauce, and brown sugar; simmer gently until chicken is cooked.
Taste, adjust seasoning, and serve with rice.

meals.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Sauté onion and red pepper until softened; add garlic and ginger.
Stir in spices and tomato paste; cook briefly.
Add tomato sauce and simmer 10 minutes.
Add chicken and simmer until cooked; stir in cream and serve.

meals.name: Szechuan Beef
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Mix a sauce: soy, brown sugar, sriracha, rice wine vinegar, five spice, chili flakes, garlic powder, ginger.
Sear thinly sliced steak on high heat.
Add sauce and simmer 1–2 minutes until it clings to the beef.
Serve over rice.

meals.name: Savoury Mince and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash with butter, salt, and pepper to taste.
Sauté onion, garlic, carrots, and celery until softened.
Add mince and brown well.
Add beef stock, Worcestershire sauce, herbs, and pepper; simmer 10–15 minutes.
Stir in peas and thicken with gravy granules. Serve over mash.

meals.name: Creamy Chicken and Bacon Pasta
method: Cook spaghetti; reserve a little pasta water.
Fry bacon, then add chicken and cook through.
Add onion and garlic; cook until softened.
Stir in cream and parmesan; loosen with pasta water if needed.
Toss pasta through sauce and serve.

meals.name: Honey Pepper Pork Stir Fry
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Toss sliced pork with cornstarch, pepper, and a splash of soy sauce.
Stir-fry broccoli and peppers; remove.
Cook pork hot and fast; add garlic and ginger.
Add honey and soy (plus a splash of water); return veg and toss. Serve over rice.

meals.name: Sun Dried Tomato and Chicken Pasta
method: Cook penne; reserve some pasta water.
Sear chicken pieces; set aside.
Sauté garlic and sun-dried tomatoes briefly.
Add cream and paprika; simmer 2–3 minutes.
Return chicken, add pasta, melt in mozzarella, and loosen with pasta water.

meals.name: Honey Garlic Chicken
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Season chicken and lightly coat with flour; pan-fry in butter until golden and cooked.
Make sauce: garlic, honey, soy, stock, and vinegar; simmer briefly.
Return chicken to coat in sauce until sticky.
Serve with rice.

meals.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken
method: Season and sear chicken in olive oil.
Add stock and cream; simmer until chicken is cooked and sauce thickens.
Stir in pesto and parmesan; warm through gently.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Serve (rice or pasta as desired).

meals.name: Chicken Korma
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Blend/crush cashews with yoghurt and a splash of water to make a creamy base.
Sauté garlic and ginger; stir in tomato paste and spices.
Add chicken and coat in the spice mix.
Stir in the cashew-yoghurt mixture and simmer gently until chicken is cooked. Serve with rice.

meals.name: Chicken Lazone
method: Cook linguine; reserve pasta water.
Season chicken with the listed spices and sear in oil/butter; remove.
Deglaze pan with stock, then add cream and parmesan.
Return chicken and simmer briefly.
Toss in linguine, loosening with pasta water if needed.

meals.name: Creamy Garlic Parmesan Chicken
method: Season chicken and lightly dust with flour; sear in butter/oil until golden; remove.
Cook fresh garlic briefly, then add stock and simmer.
Add cream and parmesan and simmer until slightly thickened.
Return chicken to warm through.
Serve with potatoes or rice.

meals.name: Chicken Fajitas
method: Slice chicken and toss with the spice mix.
Stir-fry chicken on high heat until cooked through.
Warm wraps in a dry pan.
Fill wraps with chicken (add your preferred toppings).
Serve immediately.

meals.name: Cajun or Plain Steak and Cheese Pockets
method: Mix the spice blend (or keep plain if preferred).
Slice steak thinly and toss with spices and a little oil.
Sear steak quickly in a hot pan.
Fill pockets/wraps with steak (and cheese if using).
Toast/bake until hot and melty.

meals.name: Sweet Ginger Chili Chicken
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Cook chicken in a pan until done.
Add garlic and ginger for 30 seconds.
Stir in soy, sweet chili sauce, honey, chili flakes; simmer 1–2 minutes.
Finish with sesame oil and serve over rice.

meals.name: Hoisin Ginger Chicken
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Sauté onion and pepper until softened; add garlic and ginger.
Add chicken and cook through.
Stir in hoisin, soy, sweet chili, tomato paste, sugar, sriracha, and vinegars; simmer to thicken.
Thicken with a little cornstarch slurry if needed and serve with rice.

meals.name: Ginger Garlic Pork
method: Stir-fry onion, carrots, mushrooms, and pepper until just tender; remove.
Cook pork until done.
Add garlic, ginger, lemongrass paste, hoisin, soy, and sriracha; simmer briefly.
Return veg and toss to coat.
Finish with sesame oil.

meals.name: Chicken Carbonara
method: Cook penne; reserve pasta water.
Cook chicken with smoked paprika in a little oil; add garlic briefly.
Whisk milk and stock; simmer and thicken with cornstarch slurry.
Stir in peas and parmesan, then toss through pasta.
Adjust consistency with pasta water and serve.

meals.name: Creamy Garlic Chicken and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash with butter, salt, and pepper to taste.
Season and sear chicken; remove.
Make a quick roux with butter and flour, then add cream to form a sauce.
Add garlic, simmer until thickened, and return chicken to warm through.
Serve chicken and sauce over mash.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Chicken Stew
method: Add chicken, chopped veg, garlic, stock, tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaves to slow cooker.
Stir in flour (or whisk flour with stock first) to help thicken.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours or HIGH 3–4 hours.
Remove bay leaves and adjust seasoning.
Serve hot.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
method: Add beef, veg, stock, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, and bay leaves to slow cooker.
Cook on LOW 7–9 hours or HIGH 4–5 hours.
Thicken at the end with a cornstarch slurry if needed.
Remove bay leaves and adjust seasoning.
Serve hot.

meals.name: Mediterranean Lamb Stew
method: Season lamb and brown in a pot (optional but recommended).
Sauté onion and garlic; stir in cumin.
Add canned tomatoes and vegetable stock; return lamb.
Simmer gently until tender, adding stock if needed.
Finish with mint and parsley.

meals.name: BBQ Pulled Pork
method: Mix a simple rub (salt, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder).
Place pork in slow cooker with stock; cook until shreddable.
Shred and stir through BBQ sauce; reduce if too wet.
Serve in breadrolls with chips.
Optional: add slaw/pickles.

meals.name: Creamy Cubed Garlic Pork Bites
method: Cube pork and sear in butter/oil until browned and cooked.
Add garlic briefly, then stir in flour.
Add stock to make a sauce, then stir in cream and parmesan.
Simmer until thickened; finish with lemon.
Serve with potatoes.

meals.name: Rosemary Garlic Pork Chops
method: Season chops (light flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder) and sear until cooked; remove.
Add butter, garlic, and rosemary; cook briefly.
Add stock and simmer to reduce.
Finish with lemon, then return chops to warm through.
Serve with potatoes.

meals.name: Unbeatable Broccoli Pasta
method: Cook fusilli; add broccoli for the last 2–3 minutes.
Fry bacon chunks until crisping.
Stir crème fraîche into bacon on low heat; add lemon zest/juice to taste.
Toss pasta and broccoli through, loosening with pasta water if needed.
Serve hot.

meals.name: Philly Pasta
method: Cook penne; reserve pasta water.
Fry bacon, then cook mushrooms and peppers until softened.
Stir in cream cheese with a splash of pasta water to make a smooth sauce.
Toss through pasta and warm through.
Serve.

meals.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
method: Brown mince in a pan.
Add spaghetti sauce and simmer 10–15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti and drain.
Serve sauce over spaghetti.
Optional: add cheese.

meals.name: Roast Chicken and Mash
method: Roast whole chicken until cooked through; rest 10 minutes.
Boil potatoes and mash.
Cook mixed vegetables.
Carve chicken and serve with mash and veg.
Add gravy if desired.

meals.name: Steak and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash.
Cook steak to your preference and rest 5 minutes.
Heat gravy and cook mixed vegetables.
Serve steak with mash, gravy, and veg.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Pork Chops and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash.
Cook pork chops until done; rest briefly.
Heat gravy and cook mixed vegetables.
Serve together.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Lamb Chops and Mash
method: Boil potatoes and mash.
Grill or pan-sear lamb chops; rest 5 minutes.
Heat gravy and cook mixed vegetables.
Serve together.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Burgers
method: Cook rashers until crisping; set aside.
Cook burger patties until done; add cheese to melt at the end.
Toast buns lightly.
Assemble burgers with rashers and cheese (add toppings as you like).
Serve hot.

meals.name: Fry Up
method: Cook sausages first as they take longest.
Add rashers to the pan and cook to your liking.
Cook mushrooms in the pan drippings (or a little butter).
Fry eggs last.
Toast bread and serve everything hot.

meals.name: Pizza
method: Heat oven as per package instructions.
Bake until crust is browned and cheese is bubbling.
Rest 2 minutes.
Slice and serve.
Optional: add sides/salad.

meals.name: Lasagne
method: Heat oven as per package instructions.
Bake until piping hot throughout and browned on top.
Rest 5–10 minutes before cutting.
Serve.
Optional: add salad/garlic bread.

meals.name: Chinese Pork Strips and Rice
method: Cook rice and keep warm.
Toss pork strips with Chinese seasoning.
Stir-fry pork on high heat until cooked through.
Serve over rice.
Optional: add veg.

meals.name: Roast Ham and Veg
method: Roast ham fillet until hot through and cooked; rest 10 minutes.
Cook potatoes and mixed vegetables.
Heat gravy.
Slice ham and serve with veg and gravy.
Season to taste.

meals.name: Chicken Kievs and Chips
method: Bake chips and chicken kievs per package directions.
Ensure kievs are hot through.
Rest briefly and serve with chips.
Optional: add veg/salad.
Serve.

meals.name: Quiche and Chips
method: Bake chips per package directions.
Warm quiche in the oven until hot (or serve cold if preferred).
Serve together.
Optional: add salad/veg.
Serve.
